name: PowerCenter:Place "=" first and "!=" or "<>" last in the list of conditions in Lookup table transformation
description:
For a Lookup Transformation place "=" operator in the first position in condition list. This rule reports violation in the following cases:
1/ if an operator "<", ">", "!=" or "<>" is placed BEFORE operator "="
2/ if an operator "<", ">" or "=" is placed AFTER operator "!=" or "<>"
output:
This report lists all Lookup table Transformations violating the rule.
It provides the following information:
Lookup Transformation full name
rationale:
A Lookup Transformation, used for reference search and transcodification, may load in memory a huge number of rows and process complex join condition (with following operators : "=","<",">") in nested loop mode. 
This could have a huge performance impact. 
The operator "=" should be in first position.
remediation: Review the design of the Lookup table Transformation.
total: Total number of Mappings, Mapplets and Folders having lookup transformation

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance
